definitions.definition: used to show that something exists or happens

examples.text: There's a restaurant around the corner.
There are two people waiting outside.
Has there been an accident?
I don't want there to be any misunderstanding.
There seemed to be no doubt about it.
In our old town there appeared to be two sorts of people.
There comes a point where you give up.
There remains the problem of finance.
There used to be a cinema here.
Suddenly there was a loud bang.
Many people believe there need to be more women in video games.
There's only four days left.
**There once was** a poor farmer who had four sons.

definitions.definition: in, at or to that place or position

examples.text: We went on to Paris and stayed there eleven days.
I hope we **get there** in time.
It's there, right in front of you!
**There it is**—just behind the chair.
We're **almost there** *(= we have almost arrived)*.
Are we nearly there yet?
Come on, I know you're there somewhere.
Hello, is Bob there please? *(= used when calling somebody on the phone)*
‘Have you seen my pen?’ ‘Yes, it's **over there**.’
There are a lot of people **back there** *(= behind)* waiting to get in.
I'm not going **in there**—it's freezing!
I left in 2008 and I haven't been **back there** since.
Can I get **there and back** in a day?
I took one look at the car and offered to buy it **there and then/then and there** *(= immediately)*.
James just **sat there** in silence.
He wasn't doing anything, just **standing there**.

definitions.definition: existing or available

examples.text: I went to see if my old school was still there.
The money's there if you need it.
This is the most exciting technology **out there** today.
Most of the system is **already there**, just waiting to be used.

definitions.definition: at that point (in a story, an argument, etc.)

examples.text: ‘I feel…’ There she stopped.
I don't agree with you there.

definitions.definition: used to attract somebody’s attention

examples.text: Hello, there!
You there! Come back!
**There you are**! I've been looking for you everywhere.

definitions.definition: used to attract somebody’s attention to a particular person, thing or fact

examples.text: There's the statue I was telling you about.
That woman there is my teacher.
**There goes** the last bus *(= we've just missed it)*.
**There goes** the phone *(= it's ringing)*.
**There goes** my career! *(= my career is ruined)*
So, **there you have it**: that's how it all started.

definitions.definition: used to show the role of a person or thing in a situation

examples.text: The fact is, they're there to make money.

definitions.definition: used to show that you think a place or an activity is not very interesting or impressive because you have already experienced it

examples.text: Not Spain again! Been there, done that, got the T-shirt.

definitions.definition: to be available if somebody wants to talk to you or if they need help

examples.text: You know I'll always be there for you.

definitions.definition: there; to there

examples.text: He's over by there.

definitions.definition: to know all about a situation because you have experienced it
in various places

examples.text: Papers were scattered here and there on the floor.

definitions.definition: not intelligent or not able to understand what is happening
used to show that you are determined not to change your attitude or opinion

examples.text: Well, you can't have it, so there!

definitions.definition: that is the situation

examples.text: It's crazy, I know, but there it is.

definitions.definition: used to say that something is very good, even if it is not perfect

examples.text: At the end of the tournament, he'll be there or thereabouts *(= he may not win, but he will be one of the best players)*.

definitions.definition: used to say that something is a very good example of something

examples.text: She visited him every day he was in the hospital. There's devotion for you.
He didn't even say thank you. There's gratitude for you!

definitions.definition: used to praise or encourage small children or animals

examples.text: Finish your lunch, there's a good boy.

definitions.definition: used to say that something has a particular quality
used to persuade a small child to stop crying or being upset

examples.text: There, there! Never mind, you'll soon feel better.

definitions.definition: used when giving somebody a thing they want or have asked for

examples.text: There you are—that'll be £3.80, please.
OK, there you go.

definitions.definition: used when explaining or showing something to somebody

examples.text: You switch on, push in the DVD and there you are!
There you are! I told you it was easy!

definitions.definition: used when you are talking about something that happens in a typical way or about a situation that cannot be changed

examples.text: There you go—that's what they're like.
I know it’s not ideal but there you go…

definitions.definition: used to criticize somebody when they behave in a way that is typical of them

examples.text: There you go again—jumping to conclusions.

wordOrigin: Old English thǣr, thēr of Germanic origin; related to Dutch daar and German da, also to that and the.
